column4: ﻿﻿hi all, im trying to run fsck on my 2nd hdd which is a NTFS FS, how do i do so? i already forced the mount, and when i try to run fsck i get an error.
ntfs is the fs type, not ntfs-3g
If you don't specify a type, it guesses from your fstab, which is ntfs-3g
What line are you using now?
type fsck and hit tab twice, do you see fsck.ntfs?
I'm not really sure you can fsck an ntfs drive, now that I'm actually thinking.
I imagine you can't fsck ntfs, which makes sense.  What are you trying to fix?
its just saying the ntfs journal did something
You'll probably wind up needing to boot windows and fix it.
fix it probably means clean shutdown.
